info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Fremont and northwestern Pueblo Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Penrose, or 22 miles northwest of Pueblo, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Penrose and Pueblo West. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
